question: Sound velocity is usually larger in solids than in liquids and gases because:
option1: solids are more elastic than liquids and gases
option2: solids are less elastic than liquids and gases
option3: volumetric expansion coefficients of liquids and gases are higher than solids
option4: frequency of sound waves decreases in solids due to Doppler shift
answer: solids are more elastic than liquids and gases
explanation: A substance is labelled more elastic if it offers greater resistance to deformation than other bodies, so that it can be stretched less than others.
